intro: Ardisia ovandensis, commonly known as the Ovandó ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrsinaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in countries like Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, red berries that are attractive to birds. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in understory layers of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
